verses.verse: And afterward <WH310> Moses <WH4872> and Aaron <WH175> went <WH935> in, and told <WH559> Pharaoh, <WH6547> Thus <WH3541> said <WH559> the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> Let my people <WH5971> go, <WH7971> that they may hold a feast <WH2287> to me in the wilderness. <WH4057>

And Pharaoh <WH6547> said, <WH559> Who <WH4310> is the LORD, <WH3068> that I should obey <WH8085> his voice <WH6963> to let Israel <WH3478> go? <WH7971> I know <WH3045> not the LORD, <WH3068> neither <WH1571> <WH3808> will I let Israel <WH3478> go. <WH7971>

And they said, <WH559> The God <WH430> of the Hebrews <WH5680> has met <WH7122> with us: let us go, <WH3212> we pray <WH4994> you, three <WH7969> days' <WH3117>journey <WH1870> into the desert, <WH4057> and sacrifice <WH2076> to the LORD <WH3068> our God; <WH430> lest <WH6435> he fall <WH6293> on us with pestilence, <WH1698> or <WH176> with the sword. <WH2719>

And the king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714> said <WH559> to them, Why <WH4100> do you, Moses <WH4872> and Aaron, <WH175> let <WH6544> the people <WH5971> from their works? <WH4639> get <WH3212> you to your burdens. <WH5450>
And Pharaoh <WH6547> said, <WH559> Behold, <WH2005> the people <WH5971> of the land <WH776> now <WH6258> are many, <WH7227> and you make them rest <WH7673> from their burdens. <WH5450>
And Pharaoh <WH6547> commanded <WH6680> the same <WH1931> day <WH3117> the taskmasters <WH5065> of the people, <WH5971> and their officers, <WH7860> saying, <WH559>

You shall no <WH3808> more <WH3254> give <WH5414> the people <WH5971> straw <WH8401> to make brick, <WH3835> as heretofore: <WH8543> let them go <WH3212> and gather <WH7197> straw <WH8401> for themselves. <WH1992>

And the tale <WH4971> of the bricks, <WH3843> which <WH834> they did make <WH6213> heretofore, <WH8543> you shall lay <WH7760> on them; you shall not diminish <WH1639> ought thereof: for they be idle; <WH7504> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> they cry, <WH6817> saying, <WH559> Let us go <WH3212> and sacrifice <WH2076> to our God. <WH430>
Let there more work <WH5656> be laid <WH3515> on the men, <WH582> that they may labor <WH6213> therein; and let them not regard <WH8159> vain <WH8267> words. <WH1697>

And the taskmasters <WH5065> of the people <WH5971> went <WH3318> out, and their officers, <WH7860> and they spoke <WH559> to the people, <WH5971> saying, <WH559> Thus <WH3541> said <WH559> Pharaoh, <WH6547> I will not give <WH5414> you straw. <WH8401>
Go <WH3212> you, get <WH3947> you straw <WH8401> where <WH834> you can find <WH4672> it: yet <WH3588> not ought <WH1697> of your work <WH5656> shall be diminished. <WH1639>
So the people <WH5971> were scattered <WH6327> abroad <WH6527> throughout all <WH3605> the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> to gather <WH7197> stubble <WH7179> instead of straw. <WH8401>
And the taskmasters <WH5065> hurried <WH213> them, saying, <WH559> Fulfill <WH3615> your works, <WH4639> your daily <WH3117> tasks, <WH1697> as when <WH834> there was straw. <WH8401>

And the officers <WH7860> of the children <WH1121> of Israel, <WH3478> which <WH834> Pharaoh's <WH6547> taskmasters <WH5065> had set <WH7760> over <WH5921> them, were beaten, <WH5221> and demanded, <WH559> Why <WH4069> have you not fulfilled <WH3615> your task <WH2706> in making brick <WH3835> both <WH1571> yesterday <WH8543> and to day, <WH3117> as heretofore? <WH8543>

Then the officers <WH7860> of the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> came <WH935> and cried <WH6817> to Pharaoh, <WH6547> saying, <WH559> Why <WH4100> deal <WH6213> you thus <WH3541> with your servants? <WH5650>

There is no <WH369> straw <WH8401> given <WH5414> to your servants, <WH5650> and they say <WH559> to us, Make <WH6213> brick: <WH3843> and, behold, <WH2009> your servants <WH5650> are beaten; <WH5221> but the fault <WH2398> is in your own people. <WH5971>
But he said, <WH559> You are idle, <WH7503> you are idle: <WH7503> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> you say, <WH559> Let us go <WH3212> and do sacrifice <WH2076> to the LORD. <WH3068>
Go <WH3212> therefore now, <WH6258> and work; <WH5647> for there shall no <WH3808> straw <WH8401> be given <WH5414> you, yet shall you deliver <WH5414> the tale <WH8506> of bricks. <WH3843>

And the officers <WH7860> of the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> did see <WH7200> that they were in evil <WH7451> case, after it was said, <WH559> You shall not minish <WH1639> ought from your bricks <WH3843> of your daily <WH3117> task. <WH1697>
And they met <WH6293> Moses <WH4872> and Aaron, <WH175> who stood <WH5324> in the way, <WH7125> as they came <WH3318> forth <WH3318> from Pharaoh: <WH6547>

And they said <WH559> to them, The LORD <WH3068> look <WH7200> on you, and judge; <WH8199> because <WH834> you have made our smell <WH7381> to be abhorred <WH887> in the eyes <WH5869> of Pharaoh, <WH6547> and in the eyes <WH5869> of his servants, <WH5650> to put <WH5414> a sword <WH2719> in their hand <WH3027> to slay <WH2026> us.

And Moses <WH4872> returned <WH7725> to the LORD, <WH3068> and said, <WH559> LORD, <WH136> why <WH4100> have you so evil <WH7489> entreated this <WH2088> people? <WH5971> why <WH4100> is it that you have sent <WH7971> me?

For since <WH4480> I came <WH935> to Pharaoh <WH6547> to speak <WH1696> in your name, <WH8034> he has done evil <WH7489> to this <WH2088> people; <WH5971> neither <WH3808> have you delivered <WH5337> your people <WH5971> at all. <WH3605>
